Job Title: Data Center Architect

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Consulting, Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
REMOTE (MUST BE IN THE UNITED STATES)   Bilingual in Russian  
As a Structured Cabling Architect, you are a seasoned professional with a deep and comprehensive understanding of network infrastructure and a proven track record in the design and deployment of structured cabling systems. Your expertise extends to cable management systems, and you stay abreast of the latest industry benchmarks and technological advancements. You thrive in a dynamic environment and are passionate about creating intricate cabling designs that align with the unique needs of our diverse clientele. Your role is not limited to design; you excel in conducting thorough site evaluations to ensure optimal cabling system implementations. Your leadership skills shine through as you mentor and guide team members, fostering their growth and development. As a natural leader, you take charge of projects, ensuring their successful execution from inception to completion. Your commitment to innovation drives you to explore and integrate cutting-edge solutions into our cabling infrastructure, positioning our organization at the forefront of the industry. 
About The Role: The Structured Cabling Architect is pivotal in designing and managing the deployment of structured cabling systems for our diverse clientele. This role demands a profound understanding of network infrastructure, expertise in cable management systems, and familiarity with the latest industry benchmarks. The ideal candidate will not only be tasked with generating intricate cabling designs and conducting site evaluations but will also mentor team members, lead projects, and drive innovation in our cabling solutions. Other responsibilities include: Design sophisticated structured cabling systems, including copper, fiber optic, and wireless infrastructures, tailored to meet client-specific needs.Be aware of trends and solutions in the marketplace from Commscope, Corning, Panduit, and others. Conduct thorough site surveys to ascertain client requirements and site conditions, ensuring designs are customized and optimized. Develop and oversee documentation for all cabling architectures, including diagrams, layouts, and technical specifications. Mentor and guide team members, enhancing their technical skills and fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement. Manage cabling projects from inception to completion, ensuring they are delivered on time, within scope, and exceed quality standards. Innovate and integrate emerging technologies and industry trends into cabling designs to ensure state-of-the-art infrastructure solutions. Facilitate seamless communication between clients, vendors, and internal teams to ensure project alignment and excellence in delivery. Perform quality assurance assessments and system testing to guarantee the reliability and efficiency of the cabling infrastructures. Provide ongoing technical support and troubleshooting, ensuring superior system performance and client satisfaction. Be experienced at scoping, pricing and developing job estimates (including take-offs and distance variation). Complete ongoing security awareness training and comply with company policies to the requirements section Identify and escalate security risks to the appropriate Executive Leadership Team member and actively contribute to remediation efforts Other duties as assigned 
Desired skills and experience: Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Information Technology, or related field, with a minimum of 10 years of experience in structured cabling systems design and implementation. Expertise in industry standards (e.g., TIA/EIA, BICSI) and compliance with local building codes. Proficient in CAD or similar design tools for precise cabling blueprints, or in working with drafters frequently. Demonstrated project management skills, with a proven track record of leading projects to successful completion. Certified in structured cabling or related disciplines (e.g., BICSI RCDD) is highly regarded. Exceptional mentorship and leadership abilities, with a passion for developing talent within the team. Innovative thinker with the ability to integrate new technologies and methodologies into cabling solutions. 
Some of Our Benefits: Unlimited Paid Time Off (PTO) Paid Parental Leave Company-funded 401k contributions 100% employer covered individual & family health insurance plans provided Transparent, candid culture with 1:1 coaching, performance reviews, and a consistent feedback loop Quirky, diverse, respectful, high-performing coworkers you'll want to achieve greatness with!

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
